title: Continuation of the National Emergency and of the Emergency Authority Relating to the Regulation of the Anchorage and Movement of Russian-Affiliated Vessels to United States Ports
summary: The document titled "Continuation of the National Emergency and of the Emergency Authority Relating to the Regulation of the Anchorage and Movement of Russian-Affiliated Vessels to United States Ports" announces that the President has decided to extend the national emergency initially declared on April 21, 2022, concerning the actions of the Russian Federation, which continue to threaten international relations with the United States. This extension, effective for one year, allows the Secretary of Homeland Security to maintain regulations on the anchorage and movement of Russian-affiliated vessels to U.S. ports. The notice will be published in the Federal Register and sent to Congress, reinforcing ongoing governmental measures in response to the situation with Russia.
